intro: Hymenolobus procumbens var. diffusus, commonly known as the spreading hymenolobus, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias, and is characterized by its small, fragrant flowers. The plant typically grows as a low, spreading shrub with hairy stems and opposite leaves. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study.
